Hold on I will change the post.  Stay tuned 

Perpetually on the move and c=
onstantly busy. 

On Sep 5, 2011, at 7:17 PM, "adamsafran" <adamsafran@yaho=
o.com> wrote:

> 
> 
> > Tucson continues to spin the blade faster and fast=
er until all that could be seen is a giant silver blur! His blade meets Gri=
mlock's blade as he angles the Katana to catch the oncoming sword with the =
sharp side of his own weapon. Yet the move was only to defend himself not s=
wing out towards them. The Dinobots may be relentless but if there is a lan=
d and defenseless creatures being tormented by intruders, the Silver Dragon=
 will not rest until the tormentors are brought to justice! True to his nat=
ure, Tucson gives it his all to defend his turf. 
> > 
> > " You leave me n=
o choice but to fight back! AND FIGHT I WILL!"
> > 
> 
> OOC - Just comment=
ing, Sandy, this is reading a bit like overkill to me. Tuscon has been unde=
r four rounds of attack from all five Dinobots, and has not taken a single =
hit. He's dodged, blocked, or evaded more than fifteen to twenty attacks in=
 the combat posts you've had back and forth, which even for a skilled warri=
or would be near impossible to do. Even Megatron was stalemated in direct c=
ombat wtih Grimlock, and up against all five Dinobots Optimus Prime nearly =
died. And Tuscon here is handling them all effortlessly, as you've put into=
 your postgs not even trying to fight back. I'm not speaking as a mod, but =
this is getting a bit silly as to how he's able to endlessly avoid every si=
ngle attack they toss his way, and they're one of the most potent teams the=
 Autobots had as far as fighting well and together went.
> 
> 

--Apple-Mail-13--197073363
